page.title: 03TYPES OF FARMING
page.content: The types of farming in the area vary considerably. In the lower areas arable farming is prodominant with cereals being grown and sold to be used for brewing. Cattle are kept on some farms and fattened up to be sold for their meat. They are stored inside in Winter and fed on hay or silage. On the higher areas sheep rearing is more viable than arable farming due to the gradient of the land and the depth of the soil. The sheep are kept for their wool rather than their meat and this is then sold at Stirling or Perth market.
